name: Clownfish
facts: Clownfish live among sea anemones for protection.
They have a special coating that keeps them from being stung.
Some clownfish can change gender when needed.

name: Sea Turtle
facts: Sea turtles can live for over 80 years.
They migrate thousands of miles between feeding grounds and nesting sites.
Their shells protect them from predators.

name: Starfish
facts: Starfish can regenerate lost arms.
They have no brain but use nerve nets to move.
There are over 2,000 species of starfish worldwide.

name: Octopus
facts: Octopuses have three hearts and blue blood.
They are masters of camouflage and problem-solving.
Some species can detach an arm to escape predators.

name: Blue Tang
facts: Blue tangs are known for their vibrant color.
They are popular in coral reefs.
They can change shades when stressed.

name: Hammerhead Shark
facts: Hammerhead sharks have a unique head shape for improved vision.
They can live up to 20-30 years.
They often swim in schools during the day.

name: Lionfish
facts: Lionfish have venomous spines.
They are native to the Indo-Pacific region.
They are invasive in the Atlantic Ocean.

name: Manta Ray
facts: Manta rays can reach up to 23 feet in width.
They are filter feeders.
They are known for their graceful swimming.

name: Moray Eel
facts: Moray eels have a second set of jaws.
They prefer rocky crevices to hide.
They can grow up to 13 feet long.

name: Sea Horse
facts: Sea horses are unique for male pregnancy.
They use their tails to hold onto seaweed.
They swim upright, unlike most fish.

name: Parrotfish
facts: Parrotfish have beak-like teeth.
They play a role in creating sand in coral reefs.
They change color and gender as they grow.

name: Triggerfish
facts: Triggerfish are known for their strong jaws.
They can lock themselves into crevices for protection.
They have vibrant, colorful patterns.

name: Barracuda
facts: Barracudas are fast predators with sharp teeth.
They can reach speeds of 27 mph.
They often hunt by ambush.

name: Whale Shark
facts: Whale sharks are the largest fish in the sea.
They are gentle filter feeders.
They can live up to 70 years.

name: Grouper
facts: Groupers are ambush predators.
They can weigh over 800 pounds.
Many species are hermaphroditic.

name: Pufferfish
facts: Pufferfish can inflate to deter predators.
They contain tetrodotoxin, a potent toxin.
They have excellent eyesight.

name: Leafy Sea Dragon
facts: Leafy sea dragons resemble floating seaweed.
They are related to seahorses.
They use camouflage to avoid predators.

name: Nudibranch
facts: Nudibranchs are colorful sea slugs.
They have incredible patterns and colors.
They feed on sponges and other small organisms.

name: Horseshoe Crab
facts: Horseshoe crabs have blue blood used in medicine.
They have existed for over 450 million years.
They are more closely related to spiders than crabs.

name: Dolphin
facts: Dolphins are highly intelligent marine mammals.
They use echolocation for navigation.
They often live in social groups called pods.
